creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Winston
markings:
Label on verso: [Paul Kantor Gallery / 348 North Camden Drive, Beverly Hills, California / Wassily Kandinsky c. 1906 (1906 crossed out) 1904 / oil on canvas board / 9 1/4 x 12 3/4 / Parc St. Cloud (crossed out) Nymphenburg (handwritten) / K580

MIA loan label: [L60.253 Mr. Donald Winston]
Inscription: [N43] (relating to Kandinsky's handlist, no. 1)
provenance:
(Galerie Valentien, Stuttgart, Germany, by 1958). (Paul Kantor Gallery, Los Angeles, California); Donald and Elizabeth Winston, Los Angeles, California; gift to MIA in 1981.[1]

[1] Donald and Elizabeth Winston had a half interest in the painting at the time it was gifted; the other half interest was donated by Winston's daughter, Betsy Wyman, Wayzata, Minnesota in January, 1992.
title: Nymphenburg
